intro: Ichnanthus gardneri, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, tuberous roots that are often harvested for their medicinal properties. Its foliage consists of alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Ichnanthus gardneri thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
